fields.Title of Contribution: <p>Mental Health in the CPA Workplace: Replacing Barriers with Boundaries</p>
fields.Description/Abstract: <p>CPAs and their employers can have a major, positive impact on colleagues and the profession by talking about, and supporting colleagues who are struggling with, mental health issues. Doing so can help our colleagues thrive and help retain good CPAs in the profession. In the near future, the issue of mental health in the CPA workplace will take on even more urgency as members of the next generation—who are not only willing to discuss mental health but will often expect to do so—enters and advances in the profession. This article describes some of the barriers to addressing mental health in the CPA workplace and how to overcome them while establishing appropriate boundaries.</p>
